= Mconf =

|| [https://github.com/mconf/ Source code] || [Home#Subprojects Subprojects] || [Home#Demo_Server Demo Server] ||

Mconf is a project that aims to create a complete and easy to use webconference system, with focus on the interaction with mobile devices and social networks.
The project is currently built on top of the open source systems [http://www.bigbluebutton.org BigBlueButton] and [http://globalplaza.org/ Global Plaza].

The source code for all projects that compose Mconf can be found at https://github.com/mconf/

You can find more information about the project at http://www.inf.ufrgs.br/prav/gtmconf (Portuguese and English)

  * For *feedbacks, suggestions and troubleshooting* (or anything else you need), contact us at our mailing list: `mconf-dev@googlegroups.com`
  * Found a *bug*? Please [http://code.google.com/p/mconf/issues/list create an issue].
  * Want to *collaborate*? Fork [https://github.com/mconf some of our repositories at github] and send a pull request!

== Demo Server ==

A demo server for Mconf-web can be found at: http://mconf.org/

== Installing Mconf ==

See [MconfInstallation this page] to find out how to install and use Mconf.

== Subprojects ==

  * [MconfMobile Mconf-Mobile]: Mconf-Mobile is an Android implementation of the !BigBlueButton client.
  * [MconfWeb Mconf-Web]: Mconf-Web is the social network built on top of Global Plaza to enable access to !BigBlueButton and the interaction with other social networks and instant messaging clients.
  * [MconfBBB Mconf-BBB]: Here you can see what we have done in !BigBlueButton and which are the differences between our !BigBlueButton version and the official one.

== Contributors ==

Mconf is being developed at the Federal University of Rio Grande do Sul (UFRGS), in Porto Alegre, Brazil. Currently everyone involved in the project is a member of the [http://www.inf.ufrgs.br/prav/ PRAV] research group. The project is funded by [http://www.rnp.br/ RNP].

Check [https://github.com/mconf our github] to see who's currently working on the project (or [http://code.google.com/p/mconf/people/list see it here at gcode]).

== Mconf base systems ==

Open source systems that form the base of Mconf.

=== !BigBlueButton ===

!BigBlueButton (BBB) is the webconferencing system used by Mconf-Web. BBB is developed in Java and Flash, and is one of the best open source webconferencing softwares (if not the best) today.

  * [http://www.bigbluebutton.org/ BigBlueButton.org]
  * [http://code.google.com/p/bigbluebutton/ BigBlueButton at Google Code]

=== Global Plaza ===

Global Plaza (also know as VCC - Virtual Conference Centre) is a project developed in Ruby on Rails to provide a virtual event service for the Internet. It uses the Isabel system to provide webconferencing.

You can find the Global Plaza project running at: http://www.globalplaza.org/
